items.title: The Best Bluetooth Trackers for Finding Your Stuff
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Bluetooth trackers help locate lost items by connecting to a phone app.
- Features include precision tracking, notifications for leaving items behind, and QR codes for item return.
- Major options include Apple AirTags and Tile trackers, each with pros and cons depending on user needs (compatibility, battery replacement).
- Apple AirTags utilize Ultra Wideband (UWB) technology for precise tracking, while Tiles have a wider range of shapes and sizes, suitable for various items.
- Recent improvements include enhanced anti-stalking measures for both brands.

items.title: This bullet hell shooter mixes retro and modern in all the right ways
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- **Game:** *Star of Providence* combines retro and modern gameplay styles in a roguelike bullet hell shooter format.
- **Gameplay:** Players explore randomly generated dungeons, collect powerful weapons, and fight diverse enemies.
- **Mechanics:** Tight controls allow for fluid movements; players can dash to escape danger and use bombs to clear projectiles.
- **Strategic Choices:** Players must make decisions regarding weapon upgrades and shop purchases that impact their success.
- **Boss Fights:** Encounter large, unpredictable bosses that require strategy and skill to defeat.
- **Pacing:** Games are fast-paced, enabling quick dungeon runs and minimal downtime between attempts.
- **Availability:** *Star of Providence* is currently available on Nintendo Switch and PC.

items.title: Teeing off at the wildly high-tech future of golf
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- TGL is a new golf league co-founded by Tiger Woods, aiming to reinvent the game for a modern audience.
- Matches take place at a unique venue, SoFi Center, featuring high-tech simulators and a 53-foot screen.
- The league incorporates elements from other sports and entertainment, like team formats and engaging audience experiences.
- Gameplay is quickened with a 40-second shot clock and a simplified scoring system, holding matches on Mondays and Tuesdays.
- Innovative broadcasting techniques include a wide array of cameras providing unique angles, including drone footage.
- The league's technological backbone involves advanced simulators, like Toptracer and Full Swing, to track shots and improve viewer experience.

items.title: The Best Indie Games We're Playing Right Now
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The article highlights various indie games recommended by Verge staff, including:
  - **Star of Providence**: A roguelike bullet hell shooter with retro and modern elements, exploring randomly generated dungeons.
  - **MainFrames**: A charming platformer set inside computers featuring an adorable floppy disk character.
  - **Sayonara Wild Hearts**: A rhythm game that combines various gameplay elements and narratives, recently launched on PS5 with new features.
  - **Die in the Dungeon**: A roguelike deck-builder with dice mechanics reminiscent of *Slay the Spire*.
  - **While Waiting**: A game reflecting on the joys of boredom with quirky minigames.
  - **Spirit Swap**: A narrative-driven match-3 game with a lo-fi soundtrack, offering more than just casual gameplay.
  - Participating in [Steam Next Fest](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=1025X1701640&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fstore.steampowered.com%2Fsale%2Fnextfest) to discover new indie games.

items.title: Major Issues for Samsung HW-Q990D Soundbar Owners After Firmware Update
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Samsung's HW-Q990D soundbar rendered unresponsive due to a faulty firmware update (version 1020.7).
- Customers report soundbar freezes on eARC input; factory resets and SmartThings access are ineffective.
- Issues reported globally, with customers from the US, Austria, Philippines, and Malaysia affected.
- Widespread complaints on [Samsung's community forums](https://us.community.samsung.com/t5/Home-Theater/Samsung-Q990D-unresponsive-after-1020-firmware-update/td-p/3168571), [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/Soundbars/comments/1jarng6/q990d_samsung_soundbar_bricked_only_shows_tv_earc/), and [AVSForum](https://www.avsforum.com/threads/samsung-hw-q990d-11-1-4-dolby-atmos-soundbar-review-one-of-the-best-just-got-better.3298094/page-33#replies-header).
- Other Samsung models like HW-Q800D and HW-S801D may also be impacted, though Q990D is primarily affected.
- Customers advised to disable automatic updates until further notice; Samsung has been contacted for comment, with some users told to send devices for repair.

items.title: Here are the best AirPods deals you can get right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Discounts on Apple's AirPods lineup are available, including AirPods Max, AirPods 4, and AirPods Pro.
- The new AirPods 4 are priced at $129 for the standard model and $179 for the model with Active Noise Cancellation (ANC).
- Current deals include the standard AirPods 4 for $99.99 and the ANC model for around $148.99 at various retailers.
- AirPods Pro (second-gen) available for $169.99, featuring better noise cancellation and a USB-C charging case.
- AirPods Max are on sale for $479.99, offering excellent sound quality and noise cancellation features.

items.title: Steam Deck, ROG Ally, and More: The Handheld PC Gaming Revolution
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Valve’s support for non-Steam Deck handhelds is developing, with SteamOS expected to be available for other devices by April 2025.
- Asus ROG Ally X receives praise as a top Windows gaming handheld, while MSI Claw is criticized.
- The Steam Deck has become a market leader, reportedly selling multiple millions of units, outpacing its competitors combined.
- The Lenovo Legion Go S aims to compete with Steam Deck but faces initial criticisms regarding performance.
- Innovations such as battery upgrades for the ROG Ally and Kickstarter projects like the Steam Deck Folio indicate ongoing development in handheld gaming tech.

items.title: Android's Find My Device App Can Now Show You Where People Are, Too
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Google updates the Find My Device app to show location-sharing contacts on a map.
- The feature was included in the March 2025 Android update and is now rolling out to users.
- Users can see friends' locations who share from Google Maps on both Android and iOS.
- A new People tab allows users to view shared locations and manage sharing options, resembling Apple's Find My app layout.

items.title: Trump’s first 100 days: all the news affecting the tech industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The Trump administration is initiating a crackdown on university protests, starting with Columbia University, demanding external control of departments.
- Department of Homeland Security agents raided Columbia University looking for students, as part of investigations related to federal terrorism laws.
- Columbia University received demands from government agencies to punish student protesters or risk losing federal funding.
- Colleges may have to empower internal law enforcement and place specific departments under academic receivership to comply with federal requests.

items.title: The Trump administration is coming for student protesters
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- The Trump administration is cracking down on university speech, starting with Columbia University.
- DHS agents raided Columbia, investigating student protesters for potential violations of federal terrorism laws.
- Columbia received demands to punish student activists and put certain departments under federal oversight or risk losing federal funding.
- Several students, including Grant Miner, were expelled or suspended for their involvement in protests.
- Mahmoud Khalil's immigration case highlights the unusual use of a McCarthy-era statute for deportation.
- Student activists are pushing back legally against the university's compliance with government demands.
- Khalil faces potential deportation while being detained by ICE, complicating his legal battles.
- The administration has indicated more actions against student demonstrators are forthcoming, conflating activism with antisemitism.

items.title: Ashly Burch's Concerns Over Sony AI Technology Replacing Voice Actors
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Ashly Burch, voice actor for Aloy in *Horizon Zero Dawn*, expresses concerns over AI technology potentially replacing her.
- A leaked demo showcased AI performing as Aloy, but developers ensured this was not for a current project and did not use Burch's performance data.
- Burch is worried about the broader implications of AI in the gaming industry during a SAG-AFTRA strike for protections against such technology.

items.title: The Electric State can’t hold a charge to save its life
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Netflix's adaptation of *The Electric State* is criticized as soulless and uninspired.
- Directed by Joe and Anthony Russo, the film's lack of storytelling depth leads to disappointment despite a large budget of reportedly $300 million.
- The protagonist, Michelle (played by Millie Bobby Brown), navigates a post-war world filled with robots while searching for her brother, Christopher.
- The film includes a variety of robot characters and pop culture references, but ultimately fails to deliver a cohesive narrative or engaging character development.
- *The Electric State* has launched on Netflix, but the review suggests it might be better to read the original book instead.

items.title: OpenAI and Google ask the government to let them train AI on content they don’t own
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- OpenAI and Google are urging the US government to allow their AI models to train on copyrighted materials, claiming it's a matter of national security.
- Responses are part of a White House request for input on President Trump's AI Action Plan aimed at enhancing the US's position in AI.
- OpenAI argues that access to copyrighted content is crucial to maintain competitiveness against Chinese AI developers who have unrestricted data access.
- Google supports this stance, stating that current copyright policies hinder proper access to data necessary for AI training.
- Many AI companies face lawsuits for using copyrighted content, including OpenAI, which has been sued by outlets like The New York Times and notable figures such as Sarah Silverman and George R.R. Martin.

items.title: Anthropic’s plan to win the AI race
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- Anthropic aims to compete in the AI sector not by mass-market consumer adoption but by focusing on building advanced AI models and vertical experiences for specific use cases.
- Their AI coding tool, Claude Code, gained 100,000 users within the first week of release, showcasing early success in their targeted strategy.
- The company plans to release more agents for various applications, moving beyond just their Claude AI model, and is working on creating smaller and cheaper models for developers.

items.title: Reddit will let you hide ads
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Reddit introduces a feature allowing users to hide ads from their feed for at least one year.
- Users can click on a “Hide” option for ads in feeds, with the icon resembling an eye with a line through it.
- The rollout begins this week across iOS, Android, and the web, gradually expanding over the following weeks.
- Previously, Reddit implemented filters for ads from sensitive categories such as alcohol and politics.

items.title: California's online child safety law blocked by judge – again
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- A federal judge has blocked California’s online child safety law from taking effect again.
- US District Court Judge Beth Labson Freeman granted a preliminary injunction favoring NetChoice, citing First Amendment concerns.
- The law, known as CAADCA, was signed in 2022 and targets online platforms accessed by children, requiring age estimation and specific privacy settings.
- NetChoice claims the law's requirements are vague and could suppress free speech.
- This is the second time Judge Freeman has blocked CAADCA; a previous ruling was partially upheld last year by the Ninth Circuit Court.
- The judge stated the law imposes significant burdens on content providers and is not narrowly tailored to protect children's privacy.

items.title: These new Roombas aren’t the robots I know and love
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- iRobot releases new vacuum models that resemble competitors like Roborock and Ecovacs.
- Company shifts focus from high-end products to midrange to expand market share.
- New features include an onboard dust compacting bin, but overall innovation appears minimal.
- iRobot warns of financial difficulties and possible shutdown within 12 months following the launch of these new products.
- iRobot's production now relies on a single manufacturer in China, altering its product uniqueness
- CEO claims new products will improve profitability but may sacrifice Roomba's distinctive features.

items.title: Vampire Survivors: our collective obsession with the quirky, genre-defining indie game
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Vampire Survivors has launched an official wiki, described as ad-free and mobile-friendly.  
- Upcoming content patch will introduce cross-save functionality across platforms.  
- The game will feature a new DLC titled 'Ode to Castlevania' with 20 characters, 40 weapons, and more, set to release on October 31st.  
- The game will also come to PlayStation on August 29th and to Apple Arcade on August 1st, now offering DLC packs for free.  
- A new DLC inspired by Among Us, titled 'Emergency Meeting,' is set to launch with 9 characters and additional content on December 18th.  
- A winter-themed update is expected soon, with new stage progression and a new mini-story mode.  
- The first story mode 'Adventures' is set to launch on December 6th, enhancing replayability for the game.

items.title: How Trump's Tariffs Are Impacting Big Tech and Other Industries
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- President Trump imposed significant tariffs on goods from Canada, Mexico, and China, with specific impacts on Big Tech and the automotive industry.
- Automakers are preparing for a considerable impact, particularly those with manufacturing in Mexico and Canada.
- Companies like Lego, BMW, and Foxconn are responding to the tariffs, with BMW stating it will absorb costs temporarily.
- Target and Best Buy CEOs warned of potential price increases in their stores due to tariff pressures, especially on items sourced from Mexico.
- The tariffs aim to address trade imbalances but may lead to increased prices for consumers across various products including electronics and food.

items.title: The Last of Us: all the news about the video game franchise turned TV series
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- HBO's The Last of Us season 2 trailer reveals action-packed sequences involving Joel and Ellie.
- Neil Druckmann expresses uncertainty about a potential third game, suggesting season 2 might conclude the story.
- Season 2 will have fewer episodes than season 1, with a planned natural breakpoint after seven episodes.

items.title: Zombies, Run! and Marvel Move maker lays off majority of staff
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Six to Start, creators of Zombies, Run! and Marvel Move, laid off nearly all staff, retaining only two.
- Layoffs were communicated via Zoom, citing financial inability from parent company OliveX to support operations.
- The Zombies, Run! app, with around 10 million users, combines fitness with audio storytelling.
- The high production costs of such games raise concerns about future content availability, although loyal users may sustain operations in the short term.
- OliveX, acquired Six to Start in 2021 but faced clashes related to company culture and operations.
- The future of subscriber content for Zombies, Run! remains uncertain as OliveX seeks potential buyers.

items.title: Tesla registrations — and public opinion — are in free fall
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- Tesla's stock has dropped over 50% since December, with significant declines in sales, especially in California.
- Cybertruck deliveries are reportedly paused due to quality issues, leading to protests outside Tesla showrooms nationwide.
- Public sentiment towards Tesla is at an all-time low, with a negative net impression of -12.8, particularly among liberals, who have dropped to 8% considering a purchase, down from 12%.

items.title: Ford hires a Twitch and PlayStation veteran to run its digital services
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Ford has appointed Mike Aragon, a former Twitch and PlayStation executive, to lead its digital services business.
- Aragon will oversee the development and marketing of services across Ford Pro, Ford Blue, and Ford Model e.
- The automaker currently has over 800,000 paid subscriptions, offering services such as BlueCruise hands-free driving.
- Ford CEO Jim Farley emphasized Aragon's experience in building valuable digital ecosystems as key to the role.
- Aragon succeeds Peter Stern, who contributed to Apple’s services and is now the CEO of Peloton.

items.title: Newsmax will pay $40 million to settle Smartmatic voting machine allegations
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Smartmatic sued Newsmax for spreading false claims regarding its voting machines in the 2020 election.
- Newsmax will pay $40 million to settle the allegations.
- The settlement was announced on March 14, 2025.

items.title: Ted Lasso is coming back for season 4
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Ted Lasso confirmed to return for a fourth season on Apple TV Plus.
- Jason Sudeikis stated season 4 is currently being written and will follow a new women’s soccer team.
- The creative team, including Brett Goldstein, is expected to return, but details on other characters are still unclear.
- The season themes center around the idea of 'leaping before looking'.
- Ted Lasso remains a significant success for Apple TV Plus, coinciding with other returning series.

items.title: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-10 Mission Set to Return Starliner Astronauts Home
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- NASA’s SpaceX Crew-10 mission was rescheduled for launch on March 14th after a hydraulic issue was resolved.
- The mission will bring home astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, who have been stranded on the ISS for nine months due to problems with their original spacecraft, Boeing Starliner.
- Crew-9 will also return to Earth two astronauts from its mission, scheduled for March 19th, 2025.

items.title: How to go back in time using Google Maps
items.author: David Nield
items.summary:
- Google Maps allows users to explore historical imagery on Street View, with available dates going back to 2007 in some areas.
- On desktop, access Street View by clicking on a location and selecting the 'Street View' panel, then use the 'See more dates' link to view available historical pictures.
- Mobile users can tap and hold on the map or select a location’s info card to see Street View and the associated historical images.
- Historical satellite imagery can be accessed via Google Earth with options to view imagery by specific years and use a timelapse feature, with some images dating back to the 1970s.

items.title: The fake promise of better Siri
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Apple claims to have transformed Siri into an AI-powered helper but it is currently non-existent.
- Siri was promoted as a flagship feature of the iPhone 16 lineup, which has led to consumer disappointment.
- The Vergecast episode discusses the failures of Siri and the gadget industry’s excessive focus on AI without delivering quality products.
- Also features a discussion on Tesla's political implications and challenges faced by the brand under Elon Musk’s influence.

items.title: Apple to Enable Encrypted RCS Messaging with Android Users
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Apple and Android users will soon exchange end-to-end encrypted RCS messages thanks to updated RCS specifications.
- The latest RCS standard includes E2EE based on the Messaging Layer Security (MLS) protocol, marking the first interoperable encryption across different platforms.
- Apple will add E2EE support for RCS messages in iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and watchOS in future updates, enhancing privacy and security in messaging.

items.title: T-Mobile is raising prices on some of its prized legacy plans
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- T-Mobile will increase prices by $5 per line for some legacy plan customers starting April 2nd, 2025.
- Affected customers were notified via text messages about the price increase.
- The increase is part of adjustments addressing 'rising costs'; specific legacy plans affected are currently unclear, but newer plans like Go5G are not included.
- T-Mobile assures that most customers will not be affected and maintains its commitment to low prices and value across all plans.

items.title: Apple’s AirPods 4 are down to their lowest price to date
items.author: Todd Haselton
items.summary:
- Apple’s AirPods 4 are discounted to $99.99 at major retailers, a 22% reduction from the original price of $129.
- They feature spatial audio with dynamic head tracking and an open design for comfort.
- An upgraded model with Active Noise Cancellation is available for $148.99, offering additional features like Adaptive Audio and wireless charging.

items.title: Here are the best robot vacuum deals right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Roborock's S8 MaxV Ultra is discounted to $1,099 ($700 off) with efficient vacuuming and mopping.
- The Roborock S8 Pro Ultra is available for $899.99 ($700 off) but lacks some features of the MaxV.
- The Roborock S8 Plus is on sale for $549.99 ($450 off) and offers good scrubbing with 6,000Pa suction.
- The Roborock Q5 Pro is reduced to $179.99 ($250 off), noted for handling pet hair effectively.
- The Dreame X40 Ultra is $999.99 ($500 off) with advanced self-cleaning and AI navigation features.
- The Dreame L20 Ultra is priced at $599.99 ($400 off) and includes a base station for cleaning processes.
- The SwitchBot S10 is now $499.99 ($700 off), a cost-effective robot that refills and dries its mop pads.

items.title: Apple is reportedly bringing live translation to AirPods
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Apple plans to introduce live translation for AirPods with the upcoming iOS 19.
- The feature enables real-time conversation translation, such as from Spanish to English.
- Apple is reportedly behind competitors like Google, which launched live translation on its Pixel Buds in 2017.

items.title: A24’s Opus is a stylish symphony of half-baked ideas
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- A24’s *Opus*, a horror-tinged thriller directed by Mark Anthony Green, explores the relationship between entertainment journalists and celebrities.
- The protagonist, Ariel Ecton, struggles with a self-involved editor while navigating the music journalism landscape.
- Featuring John Malkovich as the reclusive star Alfred Moretti, the film includes original songs and a stylish visual presentation.
- *Opus* starts strong but loses mystery as the plot unfolds with predictable twists and unimpressive character dynamics.
- Set for theatrical release on March 14th, the film's strong soundtrack and Malkovich's performance may still engage viewers despite its flaws.

items.title: Google is rolling out a fix for broken Chromecasts
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Google is addressing 'untrusted device' errors affecting Chromecast devices.
- Errors impacted mainly Chromecast 2nd generation and Chromecast Audio models, reportedly due to an expired certificate.
- A fix is being rolled out and will complete within days; devices must be connected to receive it.
- Users facing setup issues after a factory reset are advised to check updates on Google's support post or follow shared user solutions on Reddit.

items.title: The Best Budget Smartphones of 2023
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Budget smartphones are now more capable, typically priced around $500 or less.
- Important factors to consider: OS upgrades, screen quality (preferably OLED), and adequate storage (minimum 64GB).
- Compromises may include slower processors, lower resolution screens, and fewer camera features compared to flagship models.
- Notable models discussed include:
  - Apple iPhone 16E: Cheapest new iPhone with a 48-megapixel camera and starting price of $599.
  - Google Pixel 8A: Offers seven years of software support, starting at $399, with a solid camera and 120Hz display.
  - OnePlus 12R: High-end feel with a Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor and 120Hz OLED screen for $500.

items.title: AI Summaries Are Coming to Notepad
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Microsoft is testing AI-powered summaries in Notepad for Windows Insiders.
- Users can summarize text by highlighting, right-clicking, and selecting 'Summarize', or using the 'Ctrl + M' shortcut.
- New features include the ability to view recently closed files and a 'draw & hold' function in the Snipping Tool.

items.title: Tesla Cybertruck deliveries reportedly on hold because the trim is flying off
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Deliveries of the Tesla Cybertruck are currently on hold due to issues with the vehicle's trim detaching.
- Customers have been informed of a "containment hold" by Tesla service representatives, although specific details about the trim issues are not mentioned.
- The hold may last several weeks and is a preventative measure linked to a reported problem with the cantrail trim over the truck’s doors.
- Previous complaints cited trim above windows as being poorly attached, raising quality concerns.
- Tesla has previously issued a recall for over 11,000 trucks due to trim adhesion problems, indicating ongoing issues with Cybertruck quality.

items.title: The hunt for the next Twitter: all the news about alternative social media platforms
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Elon Musk took over Twitter (now called X) over two years ago, leading to the rise of alternative platforms like Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
- Threads reached 275 million monthly users by October 2024 and is focusing on integration with the fediverse utilizing ActivityPub protocol.
- Bluesky, despite its growth, has 14.5 million users, less than Threads, and has seen a surge post-2024 elections.
- Mastodon continues to exist but struggles for growth compared to the others.
- No clear successor to Twitter has emerged, though X remains dominant for many users and businesses.
- New features from Bluesky include moderation updates, new video capabilities, and apps like Flashes for enhanced media posting.

items.title: WinRing0: Why Windows is flagging your PC monitoring and fan control apps as a threat
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Windows Defender flagged a tool called WinRing0 as a HackTool, affecting many PC monitoring and fan control applications.
- The detection led to various software misbehaving, such as fans running excessively.
- Programs affected include Fan Control, Razer Synapse, and MSI Afterburner, all of which used WinRing0 for hardware monitoring.
- Developers express concern as WinRing0 poses a real vulnerability that could be exploited, although its current use in these applications is not malicious.
- Microsoft has been pressured to tighten security around kernel-level drivers after previous incidents and may not have communicated the changes clearly.
- Developers have explored alternatives but face challenges due to high costs associated with getting drivers signed by Microsoft, restricting open-source projects.
- Some companies are finding ways to address this issue, hoping to create a signed version of WinRing0 to help affected applications.

items.title: The best Garmin watches for training and everyday life
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Garmin watches are popular among various athletes and outdoor enthusiasts, known for fitness tracking and rugged durability.
- Recent Garmin models cater to both athletes and general users, emphasizing fitness metrics, GPS navigation, and long battery life.
- Notably, Garmin watches have features such as offline maps, advanced training metrics, and safety capabilities like fall detection.
- The Forerunner 265/265S offers a balance of price and features, including an OLED display and long battery life, priced at about $450.
- The Epix Pro provides extensive fitness features, available in multiple sizes, combining the best of Garmin's offerings starting at $720.

items.title: The Olympics will stay on NBC for at least another decade
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- NBC has extended its media rights deal with the International Olympic Committee (IOC) to air the Olympics until 2036.
- The previous agreement allowed NBC to stream the Olympics through 2032; the new deal is valued at $3 billion for the 2033 to 2036 cycle.
- Last year's Olympics led to a 33% increase in viewers on Peacock, indicating the importance of the event for NBC's streaming platform.

items.title: Flatiron Books says it will keep publishing book from ex-Meta employee
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Flatiron Books will continue to publish the book "Careless People" by ex-Meta staffer Sarah Wynn-Williams despite a recent arbitration order.
- The arbitration ruling instructed the author to stop making "disparaging" remarks against Meta and cease promoting the book.
- Macmillan, Flatiron's parent company, condemned Meta's tactics to silence the author and affirmed their commitment to the book after thorough editing and vetting.

items.title: Mercedes-Benz is hedging its bets with rebooted CLA sedan
items.author: Abigail Bassett
items.summary:
- Mercedes-Benz’s electric vehicles have underperformed, prompting a reevaluation of their electrification strategy.
- CEO Ola Källenius announced the introduction of the MMA platform, which will support internal combustion, hybrid, and electric vehicles.
- The CLA sedan will debut as an EV first, primarily focusing on enhancing passenger space and comfort.
- The vehicle will feature two battery options, with the U.S. getting a larger 85.5 kWh battery, targeting a range of approximately 350 miles.
- It will incorporate advanced braking technology and 800-volt architecture for ultra-fast charging capabilities.
- The CLA includes a new software stack, MB.OS, that offers an AI-enhanced user experience and the potential for semi-autonomous driving features.
- The electric CLA is set to launch first in China and Europe, with U.S. availability planned for the fall, although pricing details remain unconfirmed.

items.title: Android 16 is getting a major hearing accessibility feature
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Android will soon support Auracast, enhancing audio broadcasts for Bluetooth LE hearing aids.
- This feature will allow users to connect directly to audio streams in challenging listening environments like airports and concerts.
- Samsung Galaxy and Pixel 9 devices will support Auracast with an Android 16 beta update, allowing users to scan QR codes for connections.
- Google announced Android 16 has reached platform stability, nearing full launch, with a focus on I/O developments.

items.title: Here are the best iPad deals right now
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Current iPad deals are available beyond major sales events like Black Friday and Amazon Prime Day.
- Discounts include the latest models such as the iPad Pro, iPad Mini, and iPad Air.
- For the 10th-gen iPad (2022), prices start at $269, with the 256GB variant at $395.
- The 11th-gen iPad (2025) starts at $329, offering upgraded storage and speed.
- The seventh-gen iPad Mini is priced at $479, featuring a new A17 Pro chip.
- Pricing for the iPad Air starts at $499, with discounts available on various configurations.

items.title: Black Mirror dreams a little dream in season 7 trailer
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The trailer for season 7 of *Black Mirror* features themes like AI, virtual worlds, and video games, all with a dark twist.
- Season 7 will have six episodes, including a sequel to “USS Callister,” with two episodes being feature-length.
- The cast includes well-known names like Paul Giamatti, Issa Rae, and Will Poulter, but details about the episodes remain secret.
- New episodes will premiere on April 10th, 2024, coinciding with other notable series releases in April.

items.title: Tesla’s Next-Gen Vehicle: Everything You Need to Know About Elon Musk’s Affordable EV
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Elon Musk has promised an affordable electric vehicle priced around $25,000 to make EVs more accessible.
- This concept was first introduced in a 2018 interview and discussed further during Tesla's 2020 Battery Day event.
- Tesla's 'Unboxed Process' manufacturing breakthrough aims to reduce costs and support high-volume production of these vehicles.
- The planned next-gen vehicle may be a crossover or hatchback, possibly featuring design elements from the Cybertruck.
- There are speculations that Tesla may simply offer stripped-down versions of Model Ys as more affordable options.

items.title: The Trump administration faces a fight over ‘biggest’ environmental deregulatory action in US history
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The Trump administration launched a significant deregulation initiative affecting numerous environmental regulations in the US.
- EPA administrator Lee Zeldin stated this was 'the greatest day of deregulation our nation has seen,' proposing 31 actions to roll back major pollution controls.
- Advocacy groups are prepared to challenge these changes legally, emphasizing the need for extensive rulemaking processes to follow due protocol.
- The EPA aims to reconsider various regulations, including those on mercury, toxic air pollutants, and greenhouse gases.
- Environmental advocates warn that the proposed rollbacks could lead to negative health impacts, despite the administration claiming they would make cars and businesses more affordable.
- The changes are accompanied by significant staffing reductions at the EPA, complicating the implementation of new rules.
